text: The Codex Sinaiticus, or "Sinai Bible", is one of the four great uncial codices, ancient, handwritten copies of a Christian Bible in Greek. The codex is an historical treasure. The codex is an Alexandrian text-type manuscript written in uncial letters on parchment and dated paleographically to the mid-4th century. Category:Biblical manuscripts Category:4th-century books Category:4th-century biblical manuscripts
title: Codex Sinaiticus
